hero.greeting: Julián Galindo is a designer and developer of digital experiences that flow from structure to aesthetics, blending backend logic with the intuition of human-centered design.
hero.description: Every line of code I write aims to unite functionality with creative expression.

about.subtitle: Innovative Designer & Creative Developer
about.parragraph1: As a designer and developer, I specialize in crafting intuitive, game-inspired interfaces with modern frontend technologies like React. My background in systems engineering and mobile development allows me to build experiences that are not only visually engaging but also structurally solid.
about.parragraph2: I'm passionate about blending creativity with logic, from designing playful prototypes in Figma to implementing dynamic functionality with backend tools. Always curious and learning, I thrive at the intersection of design and code, building digital experiences that connect with people.
about.idea1: Developing complete back-end & front-end applications with React Technology.
about.idea2: Creating interfaces and previews of mobile apps and videogames with high-quality prototyping tools.
about.idea3: Planning and achieving projects through the application of agile methodologies.

information.text: Design, engineering, and product thinking converge in my daily practice—building expressive, structured experiences.
paragraphs: I’m Julián Galindo, a Design student at Universidad de los Andes, focused on video games, interfaces, and digital experiences. I’m graduating in 2028, and I enjoy anything that involves creating, exploring, and understanding how people interact with what they use.

I like observing, questioning, and analyzing why something works the way it does. I enjoy thinking in systems, how things connect, and how good design can make an experience clearer, more pleasant, and more human. I’m a mix of the technical and the sensitive: I like structure, but also aesthetics; logic, but also emotion.

Film, video games, and music shape how I see design: as a way to tell something, to build atmospheres, and to create moments that feel genuine. I’m constantly interested in learning, refining my visual judgment, and finding new ways to turn ideas into experiences that truly make sense.

inspirations.text: I draw inspiration from interactive media, architectural composition, and minimalist interface systems.

hobbies.text: Sketching concepts, prototyping interfaces, refining code bases, and exploring visual computation research.

portfolio.title: Digital

description.paragraph1: This portfolio website serves as a comprehensive digital showcase of my professional work, technical skills, and design expertise. Built with modern web technologies, it provides visitors with an intuitive and engaging way to explore my projects, view my certifications, and understand my capabilities as both a developer and designer.
description.paragraph2: The project emphasizes clean design, smooth interactions, and accessibility across all devices, demonstrating my commitment to creating user-centered digital experiences that balance aesthetics with functionality.

portfolio.context: Nowadays, potential employers and clients expect to see working examples of a candidate's skills. Then, the creation of a digital portfolio becomes essential to effectively demonstrate one's abilities.
portfolio.problem: Usually, designers and developers create very different portfolios for showcasing their work, making it hard to find a balance between design and development skills. Many portfolios focus solely on visual appeal or technical prowess, neglecting the importance of integrating both aspects seamlessly. This project aims to solve that problem by creating a unified platform that highlights my dual expertise in design and development.

phases.title: Research & Discovery
phases.description: I began by analyzing 30+ developer and designer portfolios, identifying common patterns, standout features, and areas where most portfolios fell short. This research phase helped me understand what makes a portfolio memorable and effective.
bullets: Analyzed successful portfolio structures and navigation patterns
Created user personas representing recruiters, hiring managers, and clients
Defined core features: project showcases, skills display, certifications
Established design principles: clarity, accessibility, personality

phases.title: Information Architecture
phases.description: Mapped out the site structure, organizing content into logical categories that would make sense to different types of visitors based on their goals and interests.
bullets: Created site map with clear hierarchies and relationships
Designed navigation system with categorized project types
Planned content flow from hero to projects to contact
Structured data for easy internationalization

phases.title: Design & Prototyping
phases.description: Created wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes in Figma, iterating on layouts, color schemes, and interaction patterns. Focused on creating a design system that would be consistent, scalable, and maintainable.
bullets: Designed modular component system with reusable patterns
Established color palette supporting both dark and light themes
Created responsive layouts for mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints
Prototyped key interactions and animation sequences

phases.title: Development
phases.description: Built the site using React, Vite, and Tailwind CSS, prioritizing clean code, component reusability, and optimal performance from the start.
bullets: Implemented component-based architecture with React 19
Integrated i18next for seamless bilingual support
Created custom animations using Tailwind and CSS
Optimized images and assets for fast loading times
Implemented lazy loading for improved performance

phases.title: Testing & Refinement
phases.description: Conducted comprehensive testing across devices, browsers, and network conditions. Gathered feedback from peers, mentors, and potential users to refine the experience.
bullets: Tested on iOS, Android, Windows, and macOS devices
Verified accessibility with screen readers and keyboard navigation
Optimized performance using Lighthouse and Chrome DevTools
Implemented fixes based on real user feedback
Conducted A/B testing on key interactions

visualDesign.description: The visual design system was crafted to reflect my dual identity as both a developer and designer—balancing technical precision with creative expression. Every color, typeface, and spacing decision was made with intentionality to create a cohesive and memorable experience.

colorSystem.title: Color System
colorSystem.description: The color palette supports both dark and light themes with semantic color tokens that adapt based on user preference.

typography.title: Typography System
typography.description: The typography system uses four main sizes to maintain hierarchy and readability across the entire portfolio.

levels.name: Heading 1 - Display
levels.description: 48px bold - Used for main page titles and hero headlines

levels.name: Heading 2 - Section Headers
levels.description: 32px semibold - Used for section headers and major subsections

levels.name: Heading 3 - Subsections
levels.description: 25px medium - Used for card titles and subsection headers

levels.name: Body Text
levels.description: 20px light - Standard body text for all content and descriptions

finalDesign.description: The final implementation brings together all design and technical decisions into a cohesive, performant, and delightful user experience. Here are the key features and pages that make up the portfolio:

homepage.title: Homepage Experience
homepage.description: The homepage features an animated hero section with a personalized greeting that changes based on time of day and displays the current date. The typewriter effect introduces visitors to my work philosophy, followed by sections showcasing skills and certifications.

projects.title: Project Organization
projects.description: Projects are organized into two main categories: Technology and Arts & Design. Each category has its own landing page with project cards that link to detailed project pages.

retrospective.description: Building this portfolio was both a technical challenge and a creative journey. Looking back at the process, there are valuable lessons learned and opportunities for future improvement.
